profileDetails.fullText:
ï»¿DATE YOU
Hey, I'm Ilyaas.
I am 20 years old, 5'9" or 174 cm looking for a monogamous relationship. I am currently living in Cincinnati, Ohio, but plan on moving to SF/NYC soon.
This webpage was last updated on: 20 Nov 2025
Who I am:
  

Dating app bio:
Tinkerer who writes code, carves wood, bends metal (and reality)
Athlete that throws weights, numbers and you around ;)


Secure attachment style
Primary love languages: Physical Touch, Quality Time, Words of Affirmation.
I can give most love languages liberally. Acts of Service and Gift giving does not come naturally, and will take time to experiment and learn.
Feedback from my last long term relationship:
* Can be rude when stressed or when focused and interrupted (working on this)
* Can hurt without intending to 
I want to have kids at some point. Most likely when I am wealthy enough for consumer things to be virtually free and when I can homeschool them myself or pay for schools that make sense, e.g. Alpha School. I will be damned if I am going to teach my kid to ask permission to pee.
I do not believe in god. I was muslim and am now atheist. I get the belief but if your beliefs limit your agency, I am unlikely to make you happy. I will happily tell our children why they should not believe though.
I am a man of routine. I want to be in one place while I build wealth. After that may be a nomadic lifestyle due to my love for mountain biking.
Why you should not date me:
* I eat clean food (mostly chicken/rice/veggies), rarely eating out (unless on a trip). If you cook me a mean steak, I will not refuse though.
* I train at the gym 5x a week.
* If you do not want to get on creatine and other longevity routines, because I want to live for a long time. If we get together, I would like to have you live with me as long as possible.
* When we fight you will get no space, at least physically, but most likely mentally too. I am much more likely to hold you while you gather yourself than let you walk off. 
* Largely traditional values, I think. I am new to the American value system so I may be wrong here.
I am looking for a partner, and the mother of my children. In this, I do not expect you to be a housewife or homemaker because that job can be replaced for 40k USD/year. A mother on the other hand, I can say due to my mother, whose upbringing has contributed to outlier outcomes.
I am looking for someone that believes in me even more than I do, and will be loyal. Someone that wants me to be more of me.
I am currently centering my life on getting smart so I can work on difficult and useful problems and create wealth on the way. The goal for me to have come to the US is to live post-scarcity. Before this, I spent some time in New Zealand because I wanted to be a professional mountain biker. There I discovered that I hate poverty more than I love mountain biking.
I live in ways that make sense to me. For example:
* I sleep on the floor
* I am happy to do dinner dates but will carry my lunchbox with me.
* I recently learned it is polite in the US to wait for your friend to start eating. Why would I do that? Why would I want my friend to be hungrier for longer? Makes 0 sense.
I do have an asian toughness or rashness I would say, and I like that untamed part of me. I have been described as, â€œthe youngest old man I knowâ€, â€œraw and realâ€, â€œannoying, real and lovingâ€, all by different people.
I will most likely go all in soon to try to break things once I am aligned, so in case things don't work out we save the most time and in case we do, I can love you for longer.
Currently I am solving a problem that involves hardware and prototyping a solution. The market seems to be relatively small but high income. Solutions seem to be DIYed but no official solutions exist yet.
I would love a TVD kind of love but have learned enough to not expect that. What I am looking for now can be accurately summed up in a cofounder for my life and family, possibly business. It could be summed up as the Hormozis, or Courtney and Cbum. As long as I am better with you, I want to be with you, because I want to be better. This could be on the homefront, on the business front, or you could be an artist and have that dynamic. I am open to most things.
I may want to go back to NZ when raising children but that is quite far away.
Life is short, and we will all die. Text me and Iâ€™ll take you swing dancing after we walk and talk.
Email: ilyaasatwork@gmail.com
Signal (preferred): https://signal.me/#eu/8rAMyrw0tr8VHJ_8HmYPrUh09N7NYxlfSBkue8poD9a-b62q3VxLNoOvYpE6Zpyd

More pictures below:
________________
        Top left: a photo describing my way of life
Top right: always hungry (for you)
Bottom left: deep in thought (maximising shareholder value)
Bottom right: mountain biking, my natural habitat

Current Priorities/Professional:

* Degrees: Doctor of Naturopathic Medicine, Masters of Science in Integrative Mental Health
* What is naturopathic medicine? Naturopathic medicine blends modern scientific research with natural and traditional forms of medicine to help activate the body's inherent ability to heal. The focus is not just on managing symptoms, but on addressing the underlying causes of illness by treating the whole personâ€”mind, body, and spirit. We serve as a doctor and a teacher, empowering the patient with the knowledge and personalized tools, like nutrition and lifestyle counseling, to achieve and maintain optimal health.
* My LinkedIn 
Long Term Aspirations:
* Host gatherings on a forested property in the PNW with a garden, sauna, and other homesteading features
* Raise 1-2 children with conscious parenting
* Open a private practice
* Write a book
* Continue to travel the world 
* Live a long life full of love, wisdom, and depth
What I do for fun:
* Social: dinner parties, potlucks, intentional relating (Authentic Relating, Circling)
* Mind-Body: Vipassana meditation, sauna and cold plunge, plant medicine
* Nature: forest bathing, backpacking, hiking, camping 
* Dance: Contact Improvisation, Butoh, Ecstatic Dance
* Performance art: Clown, Social Practice
* Sports: Badminton, Pickleball, Tennis, Bouldering, White water kayaking
* Music: DJ Monel on Soundcloud 
Personality:
* Astrology: Sagittarius Sun, Aquarius Moon, Cancer Ascendant
* Myers-Briggs Type Indicator: ENFP (Extraversion, Intuition, Feeling, Perceiving)
* Human Design: Manifesting Generator
* Chinese Astrology: Year of the Dragon
* I am grounded, logical, and have emotional maturity
* I am good at advocating my needs
* I am low technology and try to be off screens as much as possible


  
  
  

Movement and Nourishment 


A little story about me:
I was born in Seoul, Korea and moved to west Los Angeles when I was 9 months old. My father had lived most of his adult life in the US and wanted to get his MBA at USC. I attended Carlthorp School then Marlborough School, and undergrad at Williams College in western Massachusetts to become a contemporary art curator. Along the way I heavily pursued Buddhist psychology living at various Zen temples and Buddhist retreat centers. While learning German in Berlin, I discovered activist art and changed my major to Studio art when I returned to school. I won a travel scholar grant to study activist art in Korea and eventually focused on durational performance art and social practice. After college I lived at an intentional community for contact improvisation called Earthdance Creative Living Project where I studied Body-Mind Centering, Authentic Movement, and a host of other embodied anatomy movement practices. I returned to Los Angeles to study Continuum Movement with Emilie Conrad until she passed away in 2014. I decided to dedicate my career to combining somatics with medicine and completed post baccalaureate pre medical training at UCLA Extension while studying craniosacral therapy. That led me to the National University of Natural Medicine in Portland Oregon where I reside to this day. 
  Community/Friendships:
* Fernhill Ecstatic Dance
* Thursday Night Contact Improvisation
* Korean American Coalition, KAC Oregon

   * New Self, New World by Philip Shepherd  
   * The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle
   * Unlimiting Mind: The Radically Experiential Psychology of Buddhism by Andrew Olendzki 
Values:

About Me

Lifestyle & Secondary Values

Geography: I enjoy living in Europe but am open to relocate if circumstances align.

Attachment & Intimacy Needs

I try to express my feelings honestly, listen carefully to understand others, and take responsibility when I misstep. Lifestyle Habits & Daily Rhythms:

Interests & Activities

About You
To an imperfect extent, I like who I am and what I do, and would like to see it in the people around me. So, Iâ€™m mostly looking for people who identifyâ€”at least partiallyâ€”with the description above and would enjoy the same activities. About Us

Philosophy & Me
Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
The eloquent Bertrand Russell (who penned the above at 84) was my gateway to philosophy (and for a fun contrast, The Good Place my gateway to ethics). Iâ€™ve always liked learning, but only philosophy has taught, and continues to teach, me to reconsider my epistemic limits and moral blind spots, to resist the norm of prejudging issues and perspectives, and to respect cognitive diversity.
I donâ€™t live and breathe philosophy, but I find myself on a closer wavelength to those on whom it has made a similar impact.
Lifestyle
Traits:
* ðŸ¢ Introverted and more comfortable in cozy places and 1-on-1 chinwags than in large crowds (though I love a jaunt through the city).
* ðŸŒ± Active, not athletic, and health-conscious, 5â€™9â€. I have no experience with drugs or drinking, though not for highly principled reasons.
* ðŸ’ž Eager to banter with and support those whom I care about.
Hobbies:
* ðŸŽ¸ Guitar and singing.
* ðŸ“š Reading, mainly philosophy, short stories, psychology (Jonathan Haidt, Joshua Greene), and politics (in moderation). Currently enjoying a book on AI alignment and writing an overview of theories of consciousness!
* ðŸ› Cooking.

Ambitions:
* Graduated and have my sights on a philosophy MA next. In the long term, Iâ€™m partial to teaching and/or doing public philosophy as Iâ€™ve done before, supplementing with UX work if needed. Above all I hope to meet a special someone with whom I can devote time to mutual growth and advocating.
Non-negotiables
* ðŸ«¶ Empathy and open-mindedness (i.e., non-dogmatism), especially in communication. I strive always to be nonjudgy and an active listener.
Beliefs
* Value Realism. There are objectively good and bad things. Itâ€™s common to misinterpret this view as necessitating a commitment to a free-floating abstractum, goodness (or The Good) and the like. Not so. Value is a property of things, like squareness and loudness are properties of bread and bellbirds, respectively; affirming these properties doesnâ€™t imply belief in a free-floating squareness or loudness. Acknowledging this point preempts the oft-made â€œargumentâ€ for skepticism that, since we donâ€™t perceive abstracta, itâ€™s dubious how we could â€œseeâ€ the goodness or badness of anything; the proper response here is that while we donâ€™t see moral value itself, we see instances thereof, akin to seeing tori in donuts or finitude in a life.
* Utilitarianism. As for my view of what instances value, I think feelings or experiences do, informally speaking. This is, in effect, hedonism, a nicely parsimonious theory of value that, when conjoined with other plausible tenets, yields classical utilitarianismâ€”I believe the most plausible moral theory. Some views I consider allies: impartialism, suffering-focused ethics, â€œdeontology for people, utilitarianism for animals.â€
* Anti-speciesism. Of the moral blind spots Iâ€™ve been led to reconsider, perhaps none do I regret failing to notice more than the belief that our species is justified in mistreating others if and because ours is more powerful, intelligent, or whatever. This type of sophistry runs through numerous exclusionary ideologiesâ€“male supremacy, racial supremacy, tribalism, Aryanismâ€“and should, I believe, be laid to rest. There are rational, logical grounds for extending moral concern to all experiencing beings (but know I donâ€™t judge anyone for failing to act consistently with their values; nobodyâ€™s perfect, least of all me).
* Politics. My politics square with my ethics (e.g. pro-foreign aid, pro-gender equality); as general descriptors, â€˜democrat,â€™ â€˜liberal,â€™ and â€˜progressiveâ€™ fit me!
* Religion. Iâ€™m an atheistâ€”though I do admit the existence of some intriguing arguments for a creator! But even if I did become more sympathetic to theism, itâ€™s unlikely it would influence my ethics or lifestyle.
* Spirituality v. ineffability. Many hold the intuition that there exists a â€œhigher powerâ€ that is not necessarily God. While I donâ€™t think this is unreasonable, I confess I cannot relate and so remain skeptical (as I likewise am of claims that meditation/drugs/NDEâ€™s can transmit spiritual knowledge). To be clear, I emphatically accept that certain states (e.g. love, grief) are inexplicable and that you can reasonably believe something even if that thing isnâ€™t scientifically verifiable/testable. However I resist the idea that oneâ€™s altered state can â€œshow themâ€ a posteriori spiritual truths (unless â€œspiritualâ€ is used loosely like â€œsublimeâ€). Perhaps this is close-minded of me. Ultimately though, Iâ€™d prefer (more so for a potential companion) that any gaps between our beliefs and formative experiences can be adequately overcome. (If you are spiritual, Iâ€™ll do my best to be understanding, not resistant.) Perhaps this should be our first conversation starter (;

If this feels like home, take the plunge: https://forms.gle/Ezn4xaC6bha5FRyX7
I will thoughtfully and intentionally read every response and similarly respond to every questionnaire or email you send me (provided you don't indicate otherwise). If you see something in the doc or questionnaire that that made you think we might be a good match please reach out and mention it  (email at top, ig: jono.underwater) . 
________________
Closing Spark
Life is short, love is long, and laughter is oxygen.
If you can toast to all three, letâ€™s see where the waters carry us.

George Wang
31 / male / 6'1"
Location:
SF (flexible)
Relationship type:
Straight, monogamous
Kids:
Maybe? Ask me about it
My pronouns are he/him but they could be all/yours :)
My love language is sending people more blog posts / essays than anyone can reasonably be expected to read
About me
One of my more load-bearing beliefs is that the world is fundamentally malleable to our actions. That the world can be a better place, that we have the power to improve it, and that
we should
try
.
The main way I currently relate to this is through technological progress. I think AI is going to make the next decade
really weird
, and not all in good ways. As soon as I was convinced this was true, I dropped what I was doing to
focus on making this societal transition safer
. This was a difficult decision with various sacrifices, the most legible of which was a ~75% pay cut (I'm lucky to have financial stability from some earlier successes), but I think this was the right thing to do and I'm glad I did.
Another of my defining values is growth: I see myself as a constant work in progress. This means many things to me â€” being a better friend, a better partner, a better citizen. It means being a sharper scientist as much as it means healing old emotional wounds, and it means developing better habits as much as it means figuring out how to relate to my existential angst.
The way I move through and understand the world is fairly
Bay Area rationalist
coded, which sometimes makes me seem like a system-2-robot kind of person, but I think I have at least as much system-1-hopeless-idealist in me.
(more recently on a "postrat" arc, though I kinda think the distinction is wrong? anyways, mostly this looks like getting much more interested in buddhism)
I take commitments seriously, which might come off as "reliable" to some people and "annoyingly conscientious" to others.
The world is full of side quests and I regularly get nerd-sniped by them. I've built an automated arbitrage bot for
MtG:O
(and eventually got banned ðŸ˜¬), dabbled in sports betting, made a couple of
small games
, and occasionally drop everything I'm doing to chase down alpha in financial markets.
I'm a bit of a dork and love games. One of my favorite framing of games is as
art working in the medium of agency
. I see games as a place to be playful, to be creative, to laugh, to cry, to feel both joy and fear, to compete, and to face challenges and overcome them.
If you like my writing, you'll probably like talking to me. A few that I like that aren't too domain specific:
My PhD cost me $1.17M (but I'd do it again)
,
Sharing is caring
,
Navigating burnout
About you
These are things I'm fairly sure I want:
You have strong values. We don't have to share all of them, but there are things that matter to you that you'd defend (they don't have to be grand, world-shattering things).
You're proactive about shaping your life. When you run into problems or see opportunities, you jump in.
You're kind and empathetic towards others. You try even when it's hard, including those you might not personally like or agree with.
You're deeply curious about the world. You care about what's true and want to learn together.
You're playful! Fun is a terminal value :)
(To be clear, I'm not perfect at all of these myself!)
About... us? ðŸ‘‰ðŸ‘ˆ
Early dates might be activities where it's easy to talk at the same time: hikes, bouldering, board games, cooking dinner together, etc. A lot of early bonding happens through talking and texting for me.
After we're a bit more comfortable, we might hang out more frequently, stay the night regularly, and text throughout the day about
increasingly mundane things
(live-tweeting your life to someone is a real love language, fight me). I also enjoy just being in the same room, so if you also work remotely, we might cowork together often.
Long-term, I'd like to live together and build our relationship into a source of mutual growth. It sounds super cliche but I mean it sincerely â€“ I'd love to have a partnership where we keep inspiring each other to be better. I also travel a decent amount for work reasons (mostly conferences), but usually in great places to visit (last year was unusually travel-heavy, but I visited Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Melbourne, and the Bay Area). It's always nice to tack some extra time on either end, and a travel partner would be even better!
I have an okay amount of social energy but am more introvert than extrovert and have decided that I mostly don't enjoy activities that involve lots of noise and not much personal space (concerts, clubs, etc). There are some exceptions, but in general I wouldn't expect this to be the kind of thing we regularly do together.
I do like trips outdoors and would love to camp / hike / climb together!
we could
both
be laying here, dying of heat exhaustion
together
Possible dealbreakers?
I don't politically identify as far left or far right. Socially, I tend to be more progressive, but otherwise I have somewhat scattered political positions.
I'm not religious. I respect those who have deeply held religious beliefs, but this  probably means we understand the world in very fundamentally different ways.
I lean towards lower thresholds for sensitivity to disgust. The kinds of compromises I try to aim for seemed to generally be fine in past relationships (and at least one partner was more germophobic than me), but if you have particularly high thresholds for disgust, this might generate friction.
What next?
This is a fairly curated window into who I am, and reality is always more complicated. I don't know what the right discount factor is, but you should apply at least a little.
If you still feel interested, then reach out! Yes, you reading this doc. If you're not sure, please err on the side of getting in contact, that's what this thing is for! The downside might be a small time cost, and the upside is hugely positive for both of us. Don't leave that +EV on the table.
Email me
, message me on
Twitter
, or ask a mutual friend to introduce us. No need for it to be a big deal either, just say hi and we can go from there!

ï»¿Connections with Martin


Iâ€™m always looking for ways to improve my life, and I believe that a few more close connections would greatly contribute to itâ€”and, hopefully, to the life of others as well! 
I created this document with the prospect to form close friendships / relationships with like-minded people. If you relate to what I wrote below, I'd love to connect! You can simply contact me through this Connection Form.


About Me


Iâ€™m a man in his late 20s speaking English and French fluently. Iâ€™m currently in Europe, but I have recently lived in the US (for 4 years) and India (for 6 months).


Core Values
Highly stable and non-negotiable guiding principles that shape my worldview, decisions, and moral framework.


* Intellectual curiosity with rational integrity: I evaluate beliefs against evidence and enjoy conversations that challenge and expand my thinking.
* Ethical responsibility / Utilitarian-leaning ethics: I consciously act to reduce suffering and improve outcomes on a large scaleâ€”through causes like animal welfare, climate change, AI safety, and global poverty.
* Emotional stability and resilience: I remain calm under stress, self-soothe effectively, and approach conflicts with reason rather than panic or overreaction.
* Deep, loving relationships: I thrive in profound 1-on-1 connections where accountability, honesty, and mutual growth are prioritized.
* Growth-oriented conflict resolution: I engage in solution-focused dialogue, tolerate relational discomfort, and prioritize repair over avoidance.
* Integrity & deliberateness: I aim to live according to my principles and consciously cultivate trust, depth, and clarity during relationships.


Tolerance for differences: Iâ€™m very willing to connect with people who fit more than 70% of these values, embracing trade-offs and growth together.


Lifestyle & Secondary Values
Traits or principles that matter to me, but are negotiable or context-dependent. Mostly applying to life partnershipsâ€”not friendships.


Life Vision & Practicalities:
* Geography: I enjoy living in Europe but am open to relocate if circumstances align.
* Family: Iâ€™d like 1â€“2 children within roughly 5â€“10 years, depending on mutual readiness.
* Career / lifestyle: I support a partnerâ€™s work and ambitions, as long as we can spend meaningful time together (2+ hours most days).
* Financial approach: I live frugally, saving or donating the rest, but am comfortable if my partner spends more on things meaningful to her.


Attachment & Intimacy Needs
* Conflict & repair: I notice when someone is hurt, but I do not chase them if they withdraw. I prefer calm, constructive conversations when both sides are ready. Because I'll care about you, I'll express it when I think you may be wrongâ€”at the same time, I'll always have your back.
* Emotional intelligence: Iâ€™m aware of my emotions and take time to process before responding, which helps me stay calm in tense moments. I try to express my feelings honestly, listen carefully to understand others, and take responsibility when I misstep. I believe that, with mutual effort, we can keep strengthening our emotional intelligence and connection as a healthy, securely attached couple.
* Emotional expressiveness: More through words, modest body language and thoughtful gifts than grand gestures.
* Preferred intimacy style: I enjoy direct and meaningful connectionsâ€”long dedicated conversations over frequent, shallow texts. I seek a monogamous relationship.
* Openness: Although I respect those who explore radical openness and playful experimentation, that is not my orientation. I do not engage much in norm-challenging lifestyles or social experimentsâ€”particularly around sex, relationships, or identity. I value seriousness, loyalty, and stability in these domains and approach them with depth rather than playfulness.


Lifestyle Habits & Daily Rhythms:
* Dietary choices: Mostly vegan; I strongly value sensitivity to animal well-being.
* Sleep & energy patterns: Typically 11pmâ€“8am; similar routines are a plus.
* Exercise & health: Small-group activities several times per week. Open to mental health practices to improve relationships and wellbeing.
* Social engagement: Few close friendships; comfortable connecting with more socially active or community-involved partners.
* Family engagement: Average.
* Minimalism: I live a simple and non-performative life without clutter, in order to focus on what truly matters.


Emotional & Cognitive Style:
* Humor: Mix of wit, playful absurdity, and sarcasm.
* Tolerance for uncertainty: Comfortable with ambiguity, but appreciate clear plans when possible.
* Romantic philosophy: Love grows deliberately; romance and thoughtful gestures (e.g., poems) are enjoyable once fundamental compatibilities are aligned.
* Role expectations: Prefer equal partnership, but open to specialization if mutually desired.


Interests & Activities
Activities or pursuits I enjoy but that donâ€™t define my ethics or essential lifestyle.


* Intellectual pursuits: Reading nonfiction, exploring philosophy, science, history, and practical wisdom; hands-on learning through building and fixing things.
* Deep conversation: Intense, thoughtful dialogue with like-minded people.
* Optimization & personal growth: Exploring methods to improve life, productivity, and learning practices.
* Nature & mindfulness: Contemplative walks or time in natural landscapes; pausing to observe wildlife or scenery inspires awe.
* Physical activities: Running, biking, swimming, weightliftingâ€”often integrated with mindfulness.


Influences
Contents that majorly influenced my worldview.


Books:
* Thinking, Fast and Slow - Daniel Kahneman    
* The Art of Living a Meaningless Existence - Robert Pantano
* Le Petit Prince - Antoine de Saint-ExupÃ©ry
* Lâ€™Ã©tranger - Albert Camus
* Existential Physics - Sabine Hossenfelder
* The Big Picture - Sean Carroll
* Doing Good Better - William MacAskill
* Emotional Intelligence - Daniel Goleman
* Waking Up - Sam Harris
* Deep Work - Cal Newport
* Sapiens - Yuval Noah Harari
* Being the Change - Peter Kalmus


YouTube channels:
* The Pursuit of Wonder
* Kurzgesagt


Feel free to send recommendations or discuss any content you like!


About You


To an imperfect extent, I like who I am and what I do, and would like to see it in the people around me. So, Iâ€™m mostly looking for people who identifyâ€”at least partiallyâ€”with the description above and would enjoy the same activities. I believe in growth and potential; so I embrace people who are not there yet (so am I) but have, deep inside, the intention to reach it.


As long as you fit some of the description, relationships, to me, transcend gender, age, culture, financial situation, or any other socio-demographic factors; please reach out to me regardless of your situation if you relate to my personality traits. Locations should not be an issue either (a priori); Iâ€™ve had close long-distance friendships which worked beautifully for me.

# Hello!
My name is Erik LÃ¶nnroth, and I am looking to meet the love of my life. Iâ€™ve written this doc to help you decide whether I'm someone worth getting to know. Iâ€™ve tried to be as honest about my shortcomings as I am about my strengths.
ðŸ’â€â™‚ï¸Â About me
Iâ€™m 39 years old, 175cm (5'9) and fortunate to be in excellent health. Iâ€™m from Sweden but live in Cape Town and currently work remotely for a strategy consulting firm based in London. I triangulate between these three locations in order to maintain my career, friendships, and family ties. Iâ€™m fluent in Swedish, English and French, and can get by in a handful of other human and computer languages.
As much as I love Cape Town for its stunning nature and colourful characters, I would consider relocating for the right person.
I donâ€™t have any kids, but hope to one day get married and start a family. If you have kids, thatâ€™s perfectly fine, as long as youâ€™re open to having a few more.
ðŸ”ŽÂ How I view things
If I have a superpower, itâ€™s my ability to observe a situation from multiple perspectives. I look for the grain of truth in each point of view, rather than rejecting any as wholly wrong or bad. I then seek to find a way forward by integrating the nuggets of wisdom from each perspective into a coherent whole. Sometimes this process can make me slow at decision making. But once Iâ€™ve decided, I donâ€™t tend to look back. To balance out my analytical tendencies, I appreciate having a partner with a well honed intuition. Someone who can say â€œthis feels rightâ€ and trust her gut. Importantly though, she needs to be good at reasoning from first principles so we can resolve disagreements respectfully.
ðŸ›¶ Marriage is a vessel
Although I wouldnâ€™t describe myself as conventionally religious, spirituality is the foundation of my life. I maintain a daily meditation practice that has taken years to cultivate, but Iâ€™ve finally found the key to consistency. Once or twice a year I attend Zen retreats in Europe or the US. These periods of intense practice have frequently sparked profound awakenings for me, leading to greater clarity, connectedness, and wisdom.
I would like my partner to walk the spiritual path with me, not as my student or teacher, but as my equal. Your practice doesnâ€™t necessarily have to be sitting meditation; it could be yoga, breathwork, prayer, embodiment practices, or anything else that opens your heart and mind. What matters is that you approach it with utmost dedication and deep curiosity. Ultimately, I view marriage as a vessel for two individuals to experience the Divine through Love, and I want my wife to share this vision for our relationship. That doesnâ€™t mean that everything we talk about has to be imbued with the language of sacredness â€” 99% of the time it wonâ€™t â€” only that we have a shared understanding of our deepest purpose on this planet: to help each other awaken. Whether you believe in God or not matters less to me than your capacity to take on each day recognising the precious gift that it is to simply be alive! My greatest fear is finding myself on my deathbed facing the bitter realisation that I held back out of fear, never daring to love fully.
ðŸ¤“Â Live to learn
Iâ€™ve dedicated my career to building innovative approaches to learning, mostly in Africa, where educational institutions are currently failing half a billion children. Over the years Iâ€™ve launched literacy interventions in Kenya, developed tablet-based teaching solutions in Zambia, and run an online mathematics tutoring startup in South Africa. At times a Quixotic mission, it has nevertheless been immensely fascinating and fulfilling.
I have an insatiable curiosity about people and things. I subscribe to a wide array of newspapers, blogs, and podcasts on everything from finance and technology to psychology and history. Admittedly, this sometimes feels like drinking out of a firehose, and Iâ€™m increasingly wondering whether I might in fact be better off on a minimal information diet. If we end up dating, one of the ways you can help me stay present is to keep reminding me to put my phone/laptop away. Preferably in another room.
ðŸŒÂ Pole to pole
I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a coincidence that as someone who constantly seeks to integrate different perspectives, I divide my time between northern Europe and southern Africa. Africa is vivid, colourful, crazy, and often dysfunctional â€” it unlocks my adventurous spirit while allowing me to appreciate the things we take for granted in the developed world. Europe, on the other hand, offers me career opportunities, family ties, and cultural belonging. As much as I would love to continue having one foot in each continent, Iâ€™m also prepared to give that up and commit to one location for the sake of marriage, if my partner is unable to follow my migratory patterns.
ðŸºÂ Into the wild
I love being active and staying in shape. Iâ€™m training for an ultra trail race later this year, which requires a lot of running and functional fitness. Iâ€™m generally a fan of anything to do with mountains and the sea, such as hiking, climbing, skiing, sailing, and surfing.
At least once a year I like to go on a proper adventure, camping out in some remote wilderness far from civilisation, swallowed up by the silence of mountains and the twinkling of stars. Though I occasionally crave the restorative benefits of escaping off-grid all on my own, most of the time I want to bring my woman along to experience the majesty. Hopefully youâ€™re the kind of lady who loves the outdoors and doesnâ€™t mind a little dirt under her finger nails.
ðŸ«ƒLetâ€™s make a food baby!
When it comes to sustenance, Iâ€™m a discerning omnivore. I enjoy cooking and I love trying out new restaurants. On a Sunday morning, Iâ€™ll walk the extra mile for specialist coffee or an artisanal bakery. However, as much as I love the finer things in life, Iâ€™m also happy to have a relaxing evening and order takeaway (but please read the most recent reviews, just to be sure!).
I drink alcohol in moderation, and often go dry for weeks at a time. I donâ€™t smoke or take drugs. Iâ€™d like to keep my mental and physical faculties sharp for many decades to come, and if weâ€™re to grow old together, itâ€™s important to me that you also look after your body and mind.
ðŸª˜Music fuels the soul
My friends and I often get together and host impromptu musical jam sessions. We play, sing, dance, chat, and party like this most weekends. Itâ€™s a blast and one of the most amazing ways of kicking off steam. Sometimes our jams attract more than 30 people â€” all levels welcome! The friendships forged over the years at these gatherings have led me to various spinoff hobbies and pursuits, including freediving, motorcycle trips, and launching a business.
â˜¯ï¸ The best and worst of me
Integrity, intellect, calm, discipline, kindness, generosity, adventure. These are the qualities I have to offer. But youâ€™re likely to also encounter judgment, doubt, and withdrawal. That is how I'll react when you let me down. I experience disappointment viscerally, and my instinct is to pull away, creating distance. Softening into faith and forgiveness instead of descending into doubt â€” thatâ€™s The Work for me. But the silver lining is this: as much as I can dish out the tough love, Iâ€™m also good at receiving it without defensiveness or deflection. You can be radically honest with me, and I will listen attentively, seek to understand your perspective, and appreciate you for having the courage to speak your mind.
ðŸ§² What attracts me
I'm turned on by women who are fully, unapologetically themselves. Those who have the courage to drop carefully maintained facades in favour of a disarming realness. profileDetails.fullText:
ï»¿Just a world traveler looking for a meaningful relationship
The Basics
Age: 43


Gender: Male


Orientation: Straight


Height: 6'2"


Ethnicity: South Asian


Location: Berkeley, California


Occupation: Principal Product Manager for Accessibility at an e-commerce company


Relationship Status: Divorced


Languages: English, Telugu (native), Hindi, Kannada, basic Spanish, basic Thai
Photos
 Kiran and India in Times Square. Kiran is a South Asian man with medium brown skin and close cut black hair. He wears a long sleeved button up collared shirt and dark jeans with Hokas. India is a golden retriever. He wears a guide dog harness and sits beside Kiran.  
    Kiran and India in front of a brick building. Kiran wears a burgundy polo and jeans with Hokas. He smiles broadly toward the camera. India leans against Kiran's leg.      Kiran and India in front of the Ed Sullivan Theatre, having just attended the taping of the Late Show with Stephen Colbert.  
Journey So Far
Hello world! - I was born in India, spent a bunch of years in the UK, and now call Berkeley home with my golden retriever guide dog, India. I travel to Seattle pretty regularly for work (1-2 weeks monthly), and through a mix of work and personal adventures, I've been fortunate enough to explore more than 30 countries over the years.


I work as a Principal Product Manager for Accessibility at a large e-commerce company, making sure everyone can shop online regardless of ability. I did similar work at other big tech companies. Having access to tech changed my life massively as a blind person, so I'm pretty passionate about making that happen for others too.


I've been blind since birth, and it's just one part of who I am. I've figured out how to adapt and be independent - honestly, it's made my life an adventure. By the way, I did not name my guide dog â€œIndiaâ€ for my country of birth. It was just a coincidence. Iâ€™ll tell you the story when we talk! If you're curious about how blind folks navigate technology or daily life, don't hesitate to ask. Or check out "The Tommy Edison Experience" on YouTube -  that guy is hilarious.
Passions & Interests
Music: I'll listen to almost anything with a good beat - Bollywood, reggae, Irish folk, Ed Sheeran (current favorite), Indian and western classical stuff... just please don't make me sit through heavy metal! Oh, and I just sing a lot, at home, in the shower or when the mood strikes me.
Reading: Total bookworm here. Growing up blind in India meant limited access to books, so now I'm making up for lost time. Huge Harry Potter fan, and currently obsessed with epic fantasies like Game of Thrones and anything by Brandon Sanderson. Sometimes I need a mental break and switch to something funny.
Trains & Travel: Ok, I'll admit it - I'm a complete train nerd. Building an N-scale model railroad layout with a friend's help, and even treated myself to a sleeper cabin on the California Zephyr for my 40th birthday. I went for the experience but I was reliably informed by fellow passengers that the views of the rockies are amazing! 




Work in progress of a railroad tunnel through a rock cliff. Model of a red rock cliff on a table in a garage. The strata is visible through horizontal divots.  Train tracks come out of the tunnel on  both the right and the left.     A train with a locomotive and two cars emerges from the tunnel portal which is made of card stock. The tunnel  portal is flat and still under construction. 


 A back view of the red rock cliff with train tracks extending to the right. The tracks bend back in a horseshoe. Green hills are visible on the other side of the table.  

  
I've been lucky enough to visit some incredible places - getting lost in Marrakech's medina with all its amazing smells and sounds, exploring the ancient temples at Angkor Wat, finally walking through Istanbul's Grand Bazaar after reading about it for years. Travel bucket list still includes Yellowstone, Caribbean islands, South America, and Australia/New Zealand. Oh, and a proper American road trip!




 Kiran and India before the Napa Valley Wine Train. 
     Kiran stands in front of the Galata tower in Istanbul, Turkey. 


 Kiran on boat. 



 Kiran sits in a helicopter pilot seat. He grins as he fiddles with the controls.  
     Kiran wades in calf-deep clear water before a small waterfall.    


Neighborhood Explorer: I'm big on exploring neighborhoods on foot - whether it's discovering hidden food gems in the bay area or wandering a new city. Did a full-day food walking tour in Istanbul once, sampling street food along the way - absolute heaven! Closer to home, I also love things like hiking the Bay Trail or spending a day exploring a new spot like Angel Island.
Food: Serious weak spot for good food - especially anything with creative spices. Thai cuisine is probably my favorite, but I'm game to try most things. Not really into bland food (British years taught me what that's like).
Current Projects: Learning conversational Spanish (hope it goes better than my failed piano experiment!). My native language is an Indian language called Telugu, and I also speak two other Indian languages, Hindi and Kannada fairly well. Can order food in very basic Thai - useful skill when you love Thai food as much as I do!
My Approach to Life
I'm definitely on the introverted side, but a good listener. Happy to chat about anything interesting but equally comfortable with quiet moments - not every silence needs to be filled, right?
Friends would describe me as loyal, curious about everything, and open-minded. I try not to judge others - we've all got our own paths.
I serve on the Board of Trustees for a national blindness non-profit, which feels like a way to give back. Sometimes I do podcasts and write blog posts about blindness awareness. Not trying to change the world single-handedly, but if I can help shift perspectives a bit, that's something.
"Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open." - Dumbledore said it better than I could!
What I'm Looking For
Looking for something real and lasting. I want to find someone who's as curious about the world as I am - someone open-minded, kind, and who finds good conversation as enjoyable as comfortable silence.
Want a partner who's up for adventures, both local (Bay Area has some great spots to discover) and eventually international when schedules allow. I travel for work pretty regularly, but I'm committed to building something solid with the right person.
I'm a firm believer that relationships should expand our worlds, not shrink them. I'm hoping to find a partner to build a life with.
Deal-Breakers
â€¢ No smokers or heavy drugs 
â€¢ No judgmental or conservative people


Communication & Dating Style
I'd rather meet in person after establishing some basic compatibility - that's when you really know if there's a connection. I'm pretty straightforward, and appreciate the same in my partner.
Long-Term Vision
I don't have children and have made the personal decision not to have them in the future. I respect others' choices regarding parenthood and am looking for someone with similar life goals.


I've built a good life in the Bay Area but would consider relocating for the right relationship. Looking for a partnership where we both have room to grow individually while building something meaningful together.
 
So much world still to explore, so many experiences to share. Hope our paths cross soon!
Get in Touch
If something here resonated with you, reach out through this form, or shoot me a DM on Instagram or email me at kirankaja12@gmail.com.


Updated March 2025

ï»¿Hey! Iâ€™m Abe, and I thought Iâ€™d share a bit about myself, in case I sound like the sort of person youâ€™d like to date.


  



Some things I like to do:
* Theater. Iâ€™ve been acting since preschool, and itâ€™s my biggest hobby. I like everything from Shakespeare[1] to Rocky Horror[2], and I try to be in at least a couple community theater productions a year.
* Engineering. Yes, my day job is as a software engineer, but thereâ€™s so much to engineering besides software. I have hobby projects in everything from electronics to architecture, and I try to apply an engineering mentality to a lot of everyday problem-solving.
* Games. I play Dungeons & Dragons (usually running the game) and other tabletop roleplaying games, as well as board & card games such as Magic: the Gathering. I had a chess phase in middle school but was never very good at it.
* Bicycling. I bike as a means of transportation, not so much as a sport, but I do enjoy it, and avoiding dependence on cars is important to me.
* Crafts & home improvements. Iâ€™ve built a few pieces of furniture for myself, and done a number of repairs and upgrades around my house. I still contract out the big stuff, but I like having the option of doing things myself.
* Reading. While the internet has somewhat supplanted physical books for me, I still consider myself an avid reader, mostly of fantasy and sci-fi. My preference is for optimistic and/or silly stories over the dark & gritty style that seems to dominate these days, so it should come as no surprise that Terry Pratchettâ€™s Discworld is my favorite series.
* And much more. I can find something to enjoy in practically any creative activity, from linguistics to cooking to politics. A couple of the skills Iâ€™m currently trying to learn are singing and videography.


  
[3]


Basic biographical details:
* 29 years old â– male (albeit somewhat gender-apathetic) â– primarily attracted to women â– single â– open to mono- or polyamorous relationships, or just new friends â– 6 ft tall (1.82 m) â– vegetarian â– not religious â– doesnâ€™t smoke, drink alcohol, or do any other recreational drugs â– fully vaccinated â– night owl
* I live alone in Richmond, California (in the East Bay, just north of Berkeley). Not looking to move any time soon, but I might be open to having you move in if we get along well enough.
* I work full-time as a software engineer at an aerospace startup, Astranis Space Technologies. We make communications satellites to bring internet access to underserved areas (and we might also be building the next Global Positioning Satellite constellation).
* I grew up in Santa Cruz, but have also lived in Seattle, Nijmegen, and Santa Barbara.
* I have Bachelorâ€™s and Masterâ€™s degrees in computer science from UC Santa Barbara (College of Creative Studies).
* I usually vote Democratic, and consider my politics to be mostly progressive, though with some libertarian leanings.
* I donâ€™t currently have any pets, though I love them. My family had cats growing upâ€”I am slightly allergic to them, but that wonâ€™t stop me. Iâ€™d love to meet any pets you have.
* Iâ€™m autistic.[4] I got a diagnosis a few years ago, though in retrospect it should have been obvious.


  



What Iâ€™m looking for in a relationship:
* Fun conversations. Iâ€™ve got a lot of things I want to talk about, from interesting things Iâ€™ve learned to projects Iâ€™m working on to fundamental philosophical questions, but even better is to sit back and listen as you share something youâ€™re passionate about.
* Physical intimacy. This doesnâ€™t have to mean sex (though thatâ€™s great too), but I want to cuddle, to hug, to hold hands. Even better if you initiate.
* Shared activities. We could build something together, go on a bike ride or a hike, or just stay in and watch a movie. Lots of things are more fun as a couple, and itâ€™s easier to go through with something high-effort but rewarding if youâ€™re doing it with someone else.
* Stability. Knowing that we can depend on each other, and that weâ€™ll be there for one another. I donâ€™t want either of us to doubt how the other feels.
* I might be open to having kids, with the right person, but Iâ€™d be perfectly fine without as well.


  



Some of my values:
* Curiosity. Each new task is an opportunity to learn something. A surface-level understanding, like one might get from Wikipedia, is enough for a casual interest, but when something grabs my attention I want to get into as much detail as possible.
* Charity. I havenâ€™t formally taken the Giving What I Can pledge, but I do donate 10% of my gross earned income each year to effective charities (currently just Givewell).
* Preparedness. My friends turn to me when they need a phone charger, a bandage, or a bobby pin. Iâ€™ve taken Wilderness First Aid training, keep a deep pantry, and motivate myself to exercise with the idea that Iâ€™ll need to be fit in an emergency.
* Humor. It can take me a while to warm up enough to someone to make jokes around them, but once I do, Iâ€™m sure I can crack you up.
* Predictability. While Iâ€™m definitely open to new experiences, I find it much easier to enjoy them if Iâ€™ve had a chance to plan and research in advance. Surprises are stressful.
* Communication. Yes, itâ€™s a clicheÌ, but I really value being explicit in what you want. Iâ€™m not always great at picking up on social cues, so please tell me directly, and Iâ€™ll try to do the same for you.
* Kindness. There are a lot of awful things in this world, but we should never be them. I strive to see the best in everyone, to never raise my voice in anger, and to genuinely care about people.


  



Reach out
If you think we might be a good fit, or just want to chat, text me at (831) 419-9368 or email me at abe.karplus@gmail.com. I hope to hear from you soon!


Frequently Asked Questions[5]
* Q: Is there a spot open in your D&D group?
A: Yes, and if youâ€™re interested (and interesting) enough, it might be yours.
* Q: Whatâ€™s your personality type / star sign / Hogwarts house?
A: I donâ€™t put much stock in any of these, but INTP / Pisces / mostly Ravenclaw but some Hufflepuff.
* Q: You havenâ€™t said much about the sort of person youâ€™re looking for. Why not?
A: I think I could be compatible with a wide range of people, and I donâ€™t want someone wonderful to exclude themself just because they donâ€™t exactly match whatever description I gave.
* Q: Whatâ€™s your favorite Shakespeare play?
A: I donâ€™t (yet) have an overall favorite, but my favorite of the comedies is Much Ado About Nothing, largely because Beatrice and Benedick feel like the only Shakespearean couple who actually are a good fit for each other, not just thrown together for the sake of the plot.


This page was last updated 13 Mar 2025.[6]

ï»¿In as many words


To love and be loved.


What I'm looking for


A deeper understanding and a genuine human connection. 


A relationship which should last a lifetime, and children, who I would like to see grow old.


A bit about me


I've probably done all of my imbibing, but when I do, I tend to have a cigarette. I don't do drugs. I like walking and running, and I'm thankful for my health. I can drive, but don't. I'll be moving into a home I'll actually own sometime in the future.


I'm learning to play the piano and hope to become quite proficient at it. I cook a lot, and don't mind vegetables in the slightest. I'm fascinated by physics, yet barely understand. I believe consciousness is a lot like a colour - entirely subjective.


Can't survive without music: Floating Points, RÃ³isÃ­n Murphy, Daniel Avery, HAIM, Kelly Lee Owens, HAAi, Ezra Collective, Lee Bong Geun, Mozart.


Reading: Tom Robbins, David Mitchell, Iain Reid, Phillip K. Dick, Cixin Liu, Haruki Murakami.


Film: Wes Anderson. And his complementary polar, Roy Andersson. Luc Besson, Guillermo del Toro, Coen brothers.


TV: Mad Men, The Office (only seen American), The Good Place, Gogglebox, Big Brother.


What I'm looking for


A woman of the world. Who has a real flair - instruments, languages, knowledge, conversation. Who blossoms rather shies away. An assuredness in herself - and I certainly don't want to be in competition! I'd prefer it if we talked with one another, and that we did this more than we talked about one another.


A lot more important than all of that, is a load of love and care.


I haven't exactly had an easy time in this world. I wouldn't want to dwell, but I've missed a lot of the joy and happiness. So to be reminded of such is a real treasure for me.


A bit more about me


I find it difficult to do some of the social aspects - which everyone else seems to be able to do - such as, to keep on top/point with the collective discussion; or find the relative clause with the fulcrum in a conversation. I'd probably be a bit better at it if there weren't the games, though. I haven't been diagnosed with autism.


I'm a bit of a realist, swaying towards the negative, but idealistic. â€” An empire is only in a mind! â€” A pensive deliberator, holistic narrator, where the only aim is to make sense and better understand. Physics is literally everythingâ€¦


The funniest part about physics is that it's not magic.


I'm not that serious! I flunk every test, simply because I canâ€¦ If I'm being told, I need to askâ€¦ I'm about as competitive as a wet sock... 


I hate conflict, but, even still, I could argue until the end of time - I just don't see the point! I don't hold any deep-seated beliefs - about this, or that. I think it's healthy to formulate an opinion, and especially, to care. I'm tired by the general discourse. Politics is literally everythingâ€¦


Only when humankind brings to an end the endeavour for prosperity, and instead works for the good of humanity, shall we truly prosper and realise wealth.


Or, as I see it, today...


When everyone is fooling everyone, everyone is a fool.


Dreams and aspirations


A job is a job for me. When I dream about my ideal home, it'd be supportive and positive. Lots of time for one another.


A relationship needs to be tender. I have endless patience, care and concern for the right woman.


A side note


We are no more intelligent than, even our earliest ancestors, we simply know more. Our evolution benefits from cooperation, as much as competition, if not more so by cooperation.


I feel, if you spend enough time with a person, you get to know one another, becoming forgiving, inclined, adaptable, agreeable, aligned and assured by them. You grow around one another, in any relationship, community, team, job and life. I'd only hope that we grow together.

I completed a relationship workshop that resulted in clarity about what I'm curious/interested (but not in any way expecting) to experience in an anchor romantic partnership. I'll list below some of that clarity; however, due to some feedback I received from a couple female friends, I've now updated this intro paragraph to make sure nobody reads the below as a list of requirements or expectations of a potential partner (which it is definitely not). Please consider the below as predilections and preferences, rather than a checklist of must-haves!
A) Acceptance of my non-monogamy.
For me to feel like I fully belong in the relationship, I've learned it's critical that my partner openly accepts me having multiple simultaneous romantic relationships, and that I retain the autonomy to pursue new ones.
B) Attraction/chemistry.
I am huge into touch, value sleeping together (in the literal sense), and love doing erotic stuff.
C) Perception that we're close peers.
This one took a lot of work to develop/unwind/discover in the workshop, and though I've learned it's important for me I'm still not yet sure why. In any case, what does "close peers" mean for me? Here's my best articulation, in five points; many of the examples derive from experiences in my own life and illustrate similar life experiences or attributes I seek in a partner.
"Close peer" #1: Overachiever. Doesn't much matter in what domain - maybe you're an elite gamer, or excel in fitness classes, or a director where you work, or finished your doctorate while founding a company, or pioneered a popular new form of tarot card therapy (yes I've encountered that latter ðŸ¤£).
"Close peer" #2: Leader. This might look like you teaching the class, running the workshop, organizing the campaign, driving the process change. Or that you lead by following, e.g. influencing others to put a full effort into the workout, modeling an innovative collaborative learning approach in the classroom that other students adopt, taking the meditation lesson to heart, signing the Giving Pledge and posting it in your house for others to follow.
"Close peer" #3: Wild. The freedom and power that comes from intentionally breaking a significant social rule, then thriving afterward. Perhaps you left a religion, risked your education by standing up for something unpopular, exited monogamy, or something comparably high-stakes that risked enduring family or social rejection or job loss.
"Close peer" #4: Seasoned. The maturity that comes from enduring a few hard knocks. Maybe you grew up in a household that lacked food security, or your baby died, or you weathered a disability you found difficult, or a parent neglected you.
"Close peer" #5: Mentally healthy. You regularly have more spoons than you need to make it through the day, and are more often than not positive and open and emotionally available.
-Someone recently asked me to describe "my tribe." I haven't found mine yet: but an overachieving altruist that wants to overachievingly altruist a bit harder as a result of their primary relationship, sounds like a kindred spirit to me.
Expectations
-I've learned that I expect roughly equal participation when it comes to the work of initiating, planning, and organizing. That means voicing the time and place and activity of proposed dates, initiating touch, proposing dinner plans, etc. should be shared roughly equally (rather than the male doing the disproportionate labor in these areas, as is the norm in heterosexual dating). This also applies to the vulnerable work of initiating the relationship conversations that are needed for a healthy relationship.
-I've also learned that my communication style merits calling out, since I have a particular approach that I've found perturbs some, while prompting others to offer kudos. My approach is this: I try to match the communication mode to the importance of the subject. To illustrate, let's say you're texting me with concerns about where we ate dinner last night. I will try to elevate the mode of communication to something real-time such as a phone call, video chat, or in-person discussion. I might even (gasp!) call you in response to your text.
In general, the more that feelings are involved or the stakes are high, the more I'll advocate to elevate the mode of communication (text < call < vid chat < in person). My reasoning is: the communication modes higher up the chain offer richer understanding since they include some or all of tone, pace, the opportunity to clarify, more words, pauses (and their absence), facial cues, and the accountability of a real-time conversation. This means fewer assumptions and more information, which I believe improves the odds of the desired twins of communication: (1) understanding and (2) being understood.
The downside is this approach requires hopping on a call, which some find less comfortable than texting, and can require a modicum of scheduling or driving to the partner, which texting doesn't. Know that for subjects like relationship status and where concerns are involved, I expect the conversation to be real-time, and I will engage using that mode where feasible.

Why am I single?

* My face is not very expressive, and I seem much colder than I actually am to a lot of people. I convey strong emotion much more with verbal explanation than with any visual cue.

Work life
Iâ€™ve decided against publishing this on the Internet. Feel free to enquire.

      * I rarely suffer from low energy and nap only infrequently
      * This is predicated on my daily rhythm giving me good sleep and nourishing food, I absolutely crash without these

Iâ€™ve had one relationship lasting a year, a handful of four-month relationships, and a fair number of short-term flings or one-off encounters. Iâ€™m in touch and on good terms with many of these people, and donâ€™t hold grudges with any. None of these were â€œbad breakupsâ€, and I have never fought with a romantic partner. ________________
Show, donâ€™t tell
  

I host a lot of events for my friends. This one was a â€œDating Discussion Forumâ€, to give people a platform to have a frank, open conversation about their experiences with dating.

In a castle in Spain, after picking a padlock to get there.

Not my child. But isnâ€™t she cute?

More detail

* Iâ€™m involved in nuclear fusion, because I believe that the world needs clean, cheap, abundant, safe energy in order to limit climate change and create abundance.

Have you thought about how far one can run in a day, and how much further it is than we can backpack?! Imagine setting up a base camp in a national park somewhere and then running all over the place for a few days. You could see so much!

* Iâ€™ve done a lot of urban exploration. I donâ€™t do as much now, but Iâ€™ve picked every lock in the Conservatory Flowers in Golden Gate Park and I still love climbing cranes.


Growth orientation
* Iâ€™m not in coaching or therapy at the moment, but Iâ€™ve gotten a ton from coaching in the past.

Sampling of things that I like talking about

* I live in San Francisco.

We each have our own units, so we donâ€™t have to agree on how clean our kitchens, bathrooms, etc are. Itâ€™s co-livinging for grownups and itâ€™s great. You might love it too. ðŸ˜€

* Effective Altruism - I co-founded a charity called Shrimp Welfare Project (SWP) after going through the Charity Entrepreneurship Incubation Program. We focus on reducing the suffering of the billions of farmed shrimps. My work at SWP is probably the thing Iâ€™m proudest of in my life to date.
â€œShrimp welfareâ€ can sound odd at first, but the pitch is surprisingly simple: 
* 230 billion shrimps are alive on farms at any moment, more than any other animal.
* The evidence suggests theyâ€™re sentient and can suffer.
* They often suffer through routine practices such as having their eyes cut off (to induce spawning) and suffocating to death at the end of their lives.
Co-founding SWP was motivated by my deep desire to reduce suffering as much as possible, and itâ€™s been a rewarding journey balancing pragmatism with ambitious goals. The work connects deeply with my values around compassion, effectiveness, and finding innovative solutions to neglected problems.
* Autistic (self-diagnosed) - In 2023 it was mentioned to me that I might be on the autism spectrum. The more I looked into this the more it seemed to ring true, so I typically identify as being autistic (though I havenâ€™t gone through a formal diagnosis). 
One way in which this manifests is that I (currently) have an eating disorder called ARFID (avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder). It basically means I have a very limited diet of preferred foods, and the thought of eating other foods triggers a physiological fight-or-flight response.
* Polyamorous - Iâ€™m in a polyamorous relationship currently, so you might hear me in one sentence talk about my husband, and in another sentence talking about my girlfriend. Iâ€™m married to a non-binary trans-guy (who is also in a relationship with a trans-woman). And I also have a cis-girlfriend.
I consider myself to be straight (which is a little confusing as Iâ€™m married to a trans-guy). We dated for ~5 years before he came out as trans, and have found our romantic relationship still works well despite it no longer being sexual - which itself isnâ€™t such a big deal when polyamorous. 
I think the definition of Relationship Anarchy appeals most to me, with all relationships just growing into whatever suits them best. That said, I find terms like "nesting partner" (for my husband) or "Comet" (for my girlfriend in America) helpful for explaining the dynamics.
Hobbies and Interests
* Making & Creating: Projects and activities I enjoy to try and mindfully unwind.
   * Animation: I love animated movies (my degree is in computer animation), particularly Pixar. Iâ€™m also writing a musical with my metamour about animation, which has been great fun.
   * Musical Instruments: I enjoy picking up piano, ukulele, or drums in phasesâ€”mainly for the fun of seeing quick progress. Right now, Iâ€™m in a piano phase, though I often cycle back to the others.
   * Construction Sets: Building LEGO (or Nanoblocks) is my go-to for unwinding. I have a desk setup in the living room to work on sets while watching TV with my nesting partner.
* Media: Like most people an avid consumer of mediaâ€¦ 
   * Reading: Generally non-fiction, my favourite book is Sapiens. I also love candid autobiographies like Strong Female Character, or Iâ€™m Glad my Mom Died. My Goodreads is here, if youâ€™re curious.
   * Music: The Beatles are my favourite band, and I love vintage covers (e.g., Postmodern Jukebox).

   * Games: I love story-driven single-player games (The Last of Us series) and 100%-ing open-world games while listening to audiobooks. My favourite board game is Gloomhaven.
What Iâ€™m Looking For
* Relationship Style - Iâ€™m looking for a partner based in the UK to share romance and intimacy with. I deeply value my relationship with my nesting partner (we have a strong bond but not a sexual relationship) and my "Comet" girlfriend (though we only see each other every few months). So it feels strange to say as someone with two partners, but I sleep alone most nights, which surprisingly enough, is starting to feel quite lonelyâ€¦ 
What I feel Iâ€™m missing is a local-ish girlfriend (while Iâ€™m based in Liverpool, my idea of "local" is pretty flexible and would include most UK cities - especially London, where I spend a lot of time anyway). 
Iâ€™d love a relationship that fits a more traditional rhythm: seeing each other regularly, spending weekends together, or staying with each other for longer stretches when it works for us.
* Good Vibes & Value Alignment - Iâ€™d love to connect with someone who feels like they just "get it." A partner who resonates with sides of me like effective altruism or animal welfare. Sharing a passion for doing good and meaningful work would make our connection even stronger.
* Love, Support & Growth - Iâ€™m seeking a relationship where we can genuinely care for and support one another. I want us to be partners in helping each other grow into our best selves, with plenty of encouragement and kindness along the way.

Problem statement
I decided to use one of the Engineering solution templates from Notion, so my problem is figuring out how to use this without making people think I need a group of overpaid college graduates to fix me.
But really, my goal is to find a loving, rewarding relationship with a female I am interested in and for whom I am willing to sacrifice the time necessary to build a relationship. Someone who is kind, intelligent, silly, curious, courageous, and empathetic. And very importantly, someone who is emotionally mature enough to realize the kind of work and sacrifices that a relationship entails.
I am pretty flexible about the actual location, since my job is usually remote. Buttt I am a sucker for good weather - Iâ€™ve lived in the Bay Area for most of my life and in Malaga, Spain for a little bit so I am not going to pretend that living in Norway would be perfect for me. But love transcends all, right? ðŸ˜›Â Iâ€™ll try to use some of the existing fields in this template that I find are surprisingly appropriate or just funny.
Goals

Non-goals
Meeting more guys. Just kidding! If you think we would be two cubes in an ice tray, regardless of what your gender is, then totally message me and we can haaanggg. See â€œImplementation and Rollout Planâ€ for contact details.
Proposed solution
Meet a lot more girls with the openness to a relationship or just a friendship depending on how we feel about each other. I see either as a win, but I want to be clear that my intention going into a meeting is 80% to date and 20% to be friends. To be clear, I love having a relationship that has the foundation of a friendship. But I am not sure how this is possible unless we read this doc, signed a binding contract to be friends, erased our memories, and then one day felt that we could be more.
I think itâ€™s easier going from â€œAh I donâ€™t see this working out as a relationship, but we can totally drink boba like every 5 weeksâ€ rather than â€œHey we drink boba like every 5 weeks, but I want to see you again tomorrow.â€
Interests and Hobbies
Programming - I am a software engineer who has worked for blockchain companies (trading and gaming-related) and I am extremely grateful that I truly enjoy my work! I love building things with an end customer in mind and I find it awesome that solving cool problems can make peoplesâ€™ lives better. Somehow, I think the universe was beautifully designed that way.
Math/Physics
I kind of have this weird liking for math competition problems and I think it is so beautiful how we can create abstractions to describe the physical world
I have explored ML, but I frankly donâ€™t really like things that are that much of a black box to the point where we are just working backwards to find the motivation from the implementation
I used to be really bad at physics in high school and kind of hated it, but in college I decided to try to do my best and I actually ended up really liking it and I was a teaching assistant for a couple of physics classes

Honesty
I am the kind of person who tries to say what is on his mind in a compassionate, caring way towards myself and others
I think short-term discomfort is worth long-term growth
I really resonate with the quote from the Kite Runner, â€œThat's the thing about people who mean everything they say.Â They think everyone else does too.â€ It just means to me that if we both trust ourselves to be honest, we can assume good intention and it just makes things soooooo much easier (and we can also move much faster haha!)
Gentleness/Kindness
I donâ€™t feel like a man needs to be â€œassertiveâ€ or â€œdominantâ€; I think being gentle and kind is strong in itâ€™s own way
I think being kind and loving and holding someoneâ€™s heart with care are so much more important and I want to be with someone who values the care I give to them

I think in a relationship fights are inevitable, but I think healthy relationships fight well

Carson McNeil is a Neuroscientist, Data Scientist, Consultant, and Researcher specializing in medical imaging, neuroscience, and machine learning applications.
With a background in both computational neuroscience and software engineering, Carson has planned and executed on high-impact projects at Forest Neurotech, Verily Life Sciences, Google, and the
University of California, Berkeley. His work bridges cutting-edge machine vision and deep learning techniques with practical applications in health, such as the development of generative models for
digital pathology. Carson's work has spanned basic research in the cognitive neuroscience of human vision, the neuroscience of Buddhist meditative states,
and many practical applications of machine learning to diagnostic healthcare problems. His research is driven by a desire to improve human health, happiness, and flourishing, whether mental or physical.
He believes in driving forward practical technologies while sharing and publishing relevant scientific findings with the world.
Carson has a long-running interest in Mysticism, and believes that there
is not such a difference between the tools we think of as "therapeutic",
and millenia-old mystical traditions such as Buddhism and Daoism. A culture,
such as ours, which is overly materialistic and has lost touch with the subjective,
the natural, and the ritualistic, is at risk of collapsing under its own weight.
Carson hopes that his teaching, writing, and research will help bridge this divide,
and make esoteric mysticism more legible to the rationally-minded scientist.
We rarely hear the inner music, but we are all dancing to it nonetheless.
- Rumi

I have two Neuroscience degrees (Caltech BA 2013, UC Berkeley Masters 2019). I have also worked as a
researcher and Data Scientist at Google Machine Intelligence, YouTube, and Verily Life Sciences. My research interests span medical imaging, neuroscience, machine intelligence, and Dharma science.

At Forest Neurotech, we are developing a device that can image and modulate functional activity
in the human brain cheaply, portably, and minimally-invasively.

within the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research org, working on fMRI research projects to model the human visual system.

in Nature. I have an ongoing interest in emotion and mental health.

ï»¿Meta: this doc is oriented toward a long term romantic relationship. Iâ€™m also open to more â€œcasualâ€ possibilities, but if thatâ€™s what youâ€™re after you should probably ignore this doc.


  



When I was 11 years old, as my 12th birthday was approaching, I noticed that the people younger than me tended to have grand ambitions - going to space or becoming president or, in my case, building a new continent. But the people older than me generally did not have such ambitions. Clearly something happened to nearly everyone as they got older, such that they gave up on their dreams and decided to get married, buy a house and have 2.5 kids instead. I was terrified that would happen to me.


So I swore very hard never to do that - never to embrace a life of mediocrity. And that basically worked.


I want a cure for aging. I want weekend trips to the moon. I want flying cars and an indestructible body and tiny genetically-engineered dragons. I want to understand minds, be able to build them and edit them and read off their internals. I want things well beyond humanityâ€™s current bounds, and the focus of my life is pursuing those goals wherever they may lead.


What I also want - very badly - is a partner for that pursuit. And I do mean a partner - not a hanger-on, not an enthusiastic supporter, but someone with grand ambitions of their own and capabilities on par with my own or perhaps even greater.
