Hi! Iâ€™m Meredith. 


About me:
* A deeply committed Christian only looking to date other Christians. 
* Iâ€™m a 36, straight, monogamous woman living in Oakland
* I drink socially; I donâ€™t smoke; I donâ€™t do drugs.
* Iâ€™m somewhere between 5ft 6in and 5ft 7in tall.
* I want biological kids, and I am anxious about my timeline. Iâ€™m only looking to meet people who want marriage and family too. If for whatever reason I canâ€™t have biological kids, I want to become a foster mom. (I am a carrier for a recessive genetic condition, but I'm open and happy to discuss itâ€”let's chat!)
* Descriptive words: bubbly, passionate, smart, kind, fun, confident, friendly
* Personality: Iâ€™ve done a lot of work on self-understanding and personal growth. Iâ€™m dependable, collaborative, and extraverted; Iâ€™m a people-person who loves helping others. 
* Values: Integrity, growth, generosity, lovingkindness, self-ownership. 
* Politics: Iâ€™m moderate-to-liberal, and I believe curiosity is key to heal the rifts in our society. Iâ€™m frustrated by modern politics; I think that Trump is serving only his ego and self-interest, while Democrats currently lack a compelling vision. I enjoy nuanced political discussion, and get my news from diverse print media sources. I'm looking for a partner who prioritizes kindness and respect above complete political agreement.
* Theology: I am a follower of Jesus. My faith is active and central to my lifeâ€”I prioritize daily prayer, time in Scripture, and putting faith into action through service and generous giving. I value deep theological discussion, but I care much more about having respectful dialog and shared spiritual growth with my partner than complete agreement.* 


Strengths: Iâ€™m the friend in my social circles who makes sure we stay connected by reaching out to get our next event on the calendar. Friends and coworkers often seek me out when theyâ€™re facing a problem to get an empathetic ear and a new perspective, to bring clarity out of confusion. I have lots of interesting ideas and I articulate my thoughts well. I get compliments on my go-to potluck food: deviled eggs. At my best, I light up the room with infectious enthusiasm and joy. (Someone actually wrote that about me in a 360 feedback a few years ago, and it still gives me warm fuzzies!) 


My Lifestyle: 
* I prioritize getting sleep, staying active, and eating healthy food. My bedtime is 9:30-10pm so I can wake up in time for quiet time and exercise before my commute. I like to get fresh produce at the local farmerâ€™s market that I cook up to have leftovers all week. My current goal is to run 3 times a week; Iâ€™d like to improve my running speed. Iâ€™ve run 2 10k races, and now Iâ€™d like to focus on my time before adding more distance. (Iâ€™d like to get to a 10min/mile pace.) I also really enjoy dance workout classes. 
* I love spending time with kids. I adore my niece and nephew (10 and 8); my niece flew out all by herself over the summer for a few days, and it was such a delight to have her visit. I try to see them in person 2-3 times a year. I volunteer with a girl in foster care (7) through the CASA program, and she brings so much joy to my life. On our outings, we go to playgrounds; get icecream; paint our nails; go swimming; read books; and more. Iâ€™m close friends with a local family with two girls (10 and 6) who are like additional nieces to me. Additionally, Iâ€™ve taught Sunday school for multiple years, and Iâ€™ve also done science mentoring and outreach with kids.  
* Iâ€™m a big reader; itâ€™s my go-to evening activity. I read a smattering of sci-fi/fantasy, â€œbook of the yearâ€ type works, mysteries, womenâ€™s lit, and self-help. I recently read â€œConnecting with Self and Othersâ€ and canâ€™t stop talking about it. Iâ€™m working through the Bosch murder mystery series currently. Iâ€™m a huge fan of Brandon Sanderson as well. 
* I host a quarterly game-playing event for the ladies at my church. Itâ€™s been a super fun time! My condo has a great shared use community space, which makes it really easy. 
* I enjoy going on adventures and trying new things. Examples: hiking / backpacking; seeing theater / musicals; scuba diving; art / craft fairs; kayaking; glass flameworking and other arts classes (love The Crucible!); cooking classes; and travel.  
* Iâ€™ve loved classical guitar since I first heard it played as a kid, and during COVID, I finally bought a nylon-string guitar. Iâ€™ve been teaching myself to play on-and-off since then, and recently have gotten back to playing about 10-15 min each evening. Current level: I can play Christmas carols for my own enjoyment (and you might have to twist my arm to get me to play for you!) 
* I have over a 1500 day streak on Duolingo; Iâ€™m learning Spanish! I have a group of Spanish speaking colleagues and other learners who also meet monthly and chat in Spanish together; and there are also Spanish speakers at my church. I get a 6-week sabbatical in 2026, and Iâ€™d like to go to Mexico (or other Spanish-speaking country) and do an immersive experience to get myself to the next level. 


Professionally: Currently, I work as a project manager in Pathology at Genentech. Iâ€™ve been in this job for a bit over 5 years, and really enjoy it. Overall, I find a lot of value in enabling high-performing teams to overcome barriers to bring about new treatments for patients. I went to college at Wheaton, IL and I got my PhD in Chemistry at UC Berkeley. 


Dating me would be like: Dancing in the kitchen with an open bottle of wine while our dinner is in the oven. Daily check-ins about your day, how you slept, whatâ€™s on your mind. You: Iâ€™m looking to build a life with someone who loves Jesus and loves me. Send me a note if youâ€™d like to connect! For those who reach out, Iâ€™d like to ask that we schedule a brief phone or video call before first. It helps me feel comfortable meeting up!


*I really do care about respectful discussion more than agreement; but as I know the following can be deal-breakers, Iâ€™d like to be up-front of some of my beliefs on hot-button topics:

Original preserved below, for posterity.
@rmushkatblat / Robert Mushkatblat
Email: bobert.mushky@gmail.com
  
  
  



Very Short Summary
Child of Soviet Jewish immigrants, software guy, calm.  70% predictable from archetypes.
A Little Less Short
Occupation: lesswrong.com
Orientation: Straight / Monogamous
Traits poorly predicted by archetypes:
* I show up to things on time, donâ€™t miss appointments, and file personal taxes well before the deadline.
* I appreciate fine dining and tea (as artforms, not merely as hedonism, though thatâ€™s good too).
* I drink infrequently (maybe 5 times in the last year?).
* I dance (international latin ballroom).
Personality: Most comfortable in groups of 2 - 6, care a lot about those things that I focus on (ethics and aesthetics both); have sometimes been called a snob (affectionately).  Not a huge fan of super loud events, though I like the occasional prog metal concert.  I like to share my joy in food with friends & partners, and figure out what they like well enough to remove the need for them to exert any sort of mental effort on making decisions in that domain if they want.  (Food is not the only thing, just a good example of how I relate to people.)


What Iâ€™m Looking For
Personality:
Despite my archetype (high-decoupling nerd male software engineer), most of my closest friendships rest more on personality fit and mutual openness + support, rather than shared careers, interests, or hobbies (excepting rationalism).  Which is to say I spend some time talking about software or x-risk with friends when off the clock, but not most of it.  I probably would not have predicted those particular friendships ahead of time.


In retrospect, important components have been:
* Ability and willingness to discriminate between factual disagreements and values differences.  See: high-decoupling.
* At the same time, not being strongly focused on contentious but intractable domains, like mainstream politics
* Having an even temper.  Many other personality traits have been highly variable; e.g. I have quite a bit of practice supporting people through bouts of imposter syndrome.
* Actually deeply giving a shit about something.  Iâ€™m not sure if this is causal but it sure has been a common thread.  That something is not always something I personally care about a ton, but itâ€™s generally intelligible to me.  Examples: the flourishing of the local community one grew up in, exploring the limits of communication styles & bandwidth for anotherâ€¦


Socialization:
I like small things more than big things.  My tolerance for size increases when I know more of the people.  Quieter is better than louder.  Unstructured is better than structured - Iâ€™m not big on board games or movie nights (ðŸ˜¬) but do like spontaneously-occurring pockets of discussion.  These are derived from how Iâ€™ve felt across many different events, activities, and relationships, and exceptions certainly exist.  Of course, the kind of relationship I expect to be healthy anticipates occasions where we meet halfway and and those were we fly solo, depending on context.


I am basically happy to pack my calendar full of socialization, obligations permitting - Iâ€™ve yet to run into situations where I was turning down opportunities to socialize because Iâ€™d had enough rather than because I didnâ€™t have the time, or because I didnâ€™t expect to enjoy myself doing that particular thing.  However, I wouldnâ€™t feel particularly bereft if I spent a week at home, if I was doing something useful with that time.


Children:
At least one, and would want to see how the first one goes before deciding on more.  Pessimistic about traditional education, mostly due to personal experience, and would pretty strongly prefer defaulting to homeschooling or thoughtful co-op arrangements.  Ultimately, though, would want to defer to whatever actually worked best for the kid, as the person with the most introspective access relevant to the situation.


Maintenance:
I take care of myself reasonably well and happily outsource other things (e.g. house cleaning).  I do have aesthetic preferences about my living spaces but put a pretty heavy penalty on things that add significant overhead in terms of time and attention.  I find doing tasks in this category much easier with another person than doing them alone, but donâ€™t want to over-promise.
Interesting things Iâ€™ve done (or have happened to me):
* I wrote the first long-form HP/f!TMR[a][b] fanfic (itâ€™s not actually great, but it is completed)
* Got as far as â€œfinished MVP and launchedâ€ with a startup while working full-time
* Have been stung by jellyfish three (3) times and lived to tell the tale
* No longer keep track of how many times someone has said "this is the best thing I've ever tasted" or similar after taking them somewhere new
* Speak mother tongue near fluently (Ñ€ÑƒÑÑÐºÐ¸Ð¹)
* Flexible[c][d] enough to do things too disturbing impressive to be written down


Hobbies (and how to get to know me):
* Ballroom dance (international latin ballroom, could use a partner)
* Choir
* Tea (currently exploring aged whites)
* Run LA rat meetup (I continue to be semi-active in the Discord server)
* Food (my FTC profile, for my writing in a totally different social context)
* Glowfic
* Used to spend time helping people get better jobs (mostly software)[e]

[b]<3  it was a big part of my life!

ï»¿Date me?  


* Hello.
* I am David.
* Date me?


If anything you read here resonates with you or makes you think maybe we should go on a date, message me! Thereâ€™s a lot of potential upside and very little downside.


If you want to make one of these yourself, here is a template.
	Vital statistics
1. Iâ€™m 30 and male.
2. Mainly gynephilic, with some exceptions.
3. I live in London and am pretty settled here.
4. Poly (what's that?) with one partner (Amber) who I live with (her other boyfriend also lives here).
5. Until recently I worked as a software developer; now Iâ€™m running a conference on effective altruism
6. Iâ€™d like to have children.
What I am like
* Cuddly, warm, affectionate
* I have a very calm disposition, low anxiety, low neuroticism, sometimes even a flat affect if tired.
* Sometimes people canâ€™t tell if Iâ€™m joking.
* Quite laughy.
* I donâ€™t think of myself as especially intro- or extroverted. I have been known to start chatting to strangers. I donâ€™t do well at massive parties where I know nobody (will bail and go home).
* Often distracted by linguistic curios. (There was a period in my late teens/early twenties when I was distracted by the subject for 3 years.)
Things I like
1. Music. I studied the clarinet here for two years before deciding it wasnâ€™t the life for me. Here is some music Iâ€™ve written. Iâ€™m working on a new one at the moment. Iâ€™m very lucky to have access to a piano at home, it increases my quality of life by a lot. I also sing in choirs and like going to small gigs (often folk).
2. I recently started going bouldering and I think itâ€™s my new favourite thing.
3. Writing silly poems.
4. Iâ€™m quite into effective altruism and thinking about ways to increase the impact I have on the world (mainly by donating money, and by volunteering my time as a software developer).
5. Creative writing. Here is a post Iâ€™m particularly proud of.
6. I really, really like hugs.
7. Improv games.
8. Reading, particularly science fiction.
9. Camping/hiking/the outdoors.
10. Currently neglected hobbies: dancing, playing board games, drawing.
What (I hope) you are like
If multiple of the below describe you, we should definitely at least chat. Each of them is a strong plus. But these are not essential, strict criteria. Far from it. They're clues. The most important thing is that we like each other and get on well.


You, my ideal person, are probably:
* relatively nerdy,
* like making jokes,
* like to be physically affectionate,
* like playing with ideas,
* hold your opinions lightly,
* are motivated to help others
* and seek new experiences,
* are curious,
* and put in an unusual amount of effort to believe true things (â€˜good epistemicsâ€™). 
* In terms of gender presentation, you probably are relatively mixed or neutral. Iâ€™m most often attracted to women at the masculine end of the spectrum. Trans folk welcome.
* You enjoy creating things in some way, whether in writing, artistically, or something else.
* There needs to be an intellectual spark. For example, you enjoy talking about abstract ideas, gaining insight about the world, speculating, metacognition, building analogies, and delving into your confusion.
Forwardly Asked Questions
Why make a â€˜date meâ€™ page? What even is a â€˜date meâ€™ page? Where is your sense of propriety?
* Dating sites are really bad at selecting for the kind of person I might want to date. But â€˜real lifeâ€™ is relatively good at this. I hope that by making this page I make it easier for people I meet in real life to know that Iâ€™m open to going on dates, find out about what that might be like, and reach out. This is my way to let people feel empowered to make a move even if it might not work out. I am way too timid about these things myself precisely because I donâ€™t know if telling a friend I like-like them would damage our friendship. It would be tragic to miss out on a great thing because we were both too timid. So this is me giving you permission, and promising not to let it change our friendship.
* Also, all the cool kids are doing it.
What are you looking for in your romantic life?
* Love. Itâ€™s one of the greatest joys in life and makes the world beautiful.
* While Iâ€™m interested in exploring relationships at any level of casualness, Iâ€™m most actively seeking something long term, ultimately to be one of the foundations of my life. Ideally, we would eventually live together.
* At the same time, I don't want to fuse with another person; we'd have our own lives, pastimes, interests, and friends/partners.
* Iâ€™m not interested in indefinitely-long-distance things.
Where do you see yourself in the future?
* Iâ€™d like to be part of a bustling community of friends who throw parties and regularly cook for each other at each otherâ€™s houses and live near each other or together. Hopefully with some casual music-making involved. Willing to move to make this happen. The model could be setting up a group house, or cooperating to live strategically close to our friends.
* Somewhat related to building a community, Iâ€™d probably like to start a family. A family is just a tiny, very close-knit community. (Aside: why do people always talk about wanting to start families, but never talk about wanting to finish one?)
* Noticing the passage of time and my desire to start a family is what triggered making this post. Iâ€™m also open to the idea of co-parenting with someone without a romantic relationship.
